string.text: I'm here on business...
Well, lay it out, what do you have there.
Listen, Barkeep, I got my hands on a nerd's PDA with information, seems like something important. Only it won't turn on, probably needs charging.
So, did you check that nerd's PDA?
Uh... slipped my mind. I'll come back later.
Important? How do you know if it won't turn on?

Well... Uh... one scientist said so when he was begging me to get it. Long story, basically. But I thought: what if... I mean, what if there's something useful for everyone there? That nerd said they were studying the possibility of creating protection from psi-radiation or something like that. We could copy everything there, and then I'll take the PDA back to its owner.

You're not telling me something, Marked One. Or decided to play for two teams at once, huh? Alright, give me the PDA here, let Docent take a look. Come back in an hour. And mind you, if it turns out you just wanted to palm off a regular PDA on me, consider that you gave it away for free.
Who do you take me for? Anyway, I'll drop by later...
Not yet. I told you: come by in an hour.

Well, yes, we checked it. Only one unpleasant thing happened. I didn't delve too deep into it, but according to Docent, there was some tricky protection there. Apparently, some code had to be entered regularly, otherwise all the info gets wiped, and the handheld itself gets locked for good.
Just don't tell me that...

That's exactly what I want to say. But hold your horses, listen first! Docent did manage to download part of the information and there really was a lot of curious stuff there. But the PDA died and can't be restored, sorry about that.
Sorry? You've got to be fuck...
Easy, Marked One, easy! Yes, it turned out ugly, no argument there. That's why I'm ready to offer you good compensation. Let me think...
What, already counting how much profit you'll make from reselling this information? And what am I supposed to do now? Start a war with the mercs hoping they have other PDAs left?! Hmm...
What, already counting how much profit you'll make from reselling this information? And what am I supposed to do now? Wait! What did Kruglov say about Wolfhound's PDA? Hm...
What, already counting how much profit you'll make from reselling this information? And what am I supposed to do now? Can't bring a broken one...
What, already counting how much profit you'll make from reselling this information? Businessman, damn your division...

What are you muttering under your breath there? Anyway, don't worry, I won't leave you empty-handed either. First, a sniper rifle - a real SVD, not some homemade crap. You won't find one like this in the Zone easily, had to get it through my channels. For VIP clients and such. Second, optics for it. And not some civilian junk, but a military PSO-1. More than generous, don't you think?
Yeah, such generosity that I might as well quit everything and retire right now. If only I knew where...
Did you expect a bag of money and a couple of suitcases with artifacts right away? As far as I'm concerned, it's quite a decent reward. Plus my good attitude towards you. Think about it.
What's there to think about... Give me your gun. At least I'll feel like a VIP.
That's more like it. Take it.
Rumor has it you regularly get videocassettes delivered with new program episodes... Like the one playing on your TV right now... Well, you know.
Interested? Who would have thought! You certainly don't look like a hermit monk, but I'll be honest - you surprised me.
We've already talked about this. Having memory problems again? Then let me remind you: for a second-level artifact in good condition, I'll share some novelty from my collection.
It's for a friend... I mean, he's not even my friend really, just asked me to get it... Anyway! Do you have anything fresh for sale or not?
I have such an artifact. Here, will this do?
Maybe a discount for old friendship? No? Alright, I'll be back when I find a suitable artifact.
I do, of course. Only not for sale, but for trade. I think a second-level artifact in good condition would be just right for such a deal.
Yes, quite. Here's the cassette. There's a rather curious selection recorded here. Some might say it's an acquired taste, but for those who have broad views on "this" matter - it's perfect.
I don't give a damn. I'm not going to watch it.
I'll sit down and rest here with you for a bit, won't bother you?
Sit down, of course, we're not doing anything anyway, just shooting the breeze.
How do you like the Zone in general? Don't regret ending up here?

Are you kidding? The Zone is a wonderful gift to humanity. Of course, you can't live here, radiation, anomalies, mutants - there are plenty of dangers. But what enormous scientific potential! It's almost a natural experiment, simply a reserve for scientists. It's hard to imagine what will happen to science after comprehensive study of the Zone. Besides purely academic knowledge, humanity can make a powerful technological breakthrough! Biotechnology, curing incurable diseases, solving environmental and food problems, fundamentally new energy sources... and who knows what else. As pompous as it may sound, I'm proud that I have the honor to be here, at the cutting edge of progress!
Oh, wow...

You stalkers can't even imagine the whole picture. And you don't want to. For you, immediate gain is always more important than any possible achievements in the future. Uh, sorry, I'm getting carried away.
It's alright, I'm not offended. And you're right, why lie. The future concerns me much less at this moment than the past.
What do you mean?

Oh right, I didn't tell you. I have memory problems. I remember myself from the moment I woke up in a village, at the Cordon. Separate fragments occasionally surface in my head, but they're too vague and disconnected...
So that's it! And what are you thinking of doing now?

What's there to think about? I'm trying to remember myself or find those who knew me before. I can't just stay and live in the Zone - surely I have a home somewhere, maybe even loved ones waiting for me. Besides, I have a couple of leads that might help in the search.

Haven't you thought about seeing doctors on the mainland? I'm not a specialist, but I know that memory problems can be caused by the most mundane reasons: from TBI and internal pathologies, like diabetes, to various mental disorders. Most of them respond to both medication treatment and...

Stop! Let's do without those fancy words of yours. I can always leave the Zone. But first, while there's hope to remember something here, I'll try to work the leads I have. And second, if nothing works out, I can't leave empty-handed. Need to live somewhere, need to eat, and I'm afraid to even imagine how much doctors will charge.
That's true. Being sick these days is an expensive pleasure. I remember once my wife sent me to the pharmacy, they prescribed her some mixture to drink for...

Wait, wait! About the mixture. I haven't pestered you yet. Basically, someone told me where to find one medicine to fix memory. But here's the problem: it's imported, supposedly Chinese, and the instructions are scribbled by hand in their language. I already went to Sakharov and asked Docent at the Bar to help - no use. Can you suggest anything?

Well, Marked One, consider yourself very lucky! You see, I lived in China for 3 years, studied at the graduate school of a university there. I won't say I mastered the language perfectly, and something might have been forgotten over time, but I think I can read your instructions. Give them here.
Now that's really lucky. I happen to have them with me. Here you go.
Yeah, lucky indeed. Only I don't have the instructions with me, stashed them for now so I wouldn't lose them accidentally. You just... wait a bit, I'll bring them soon.

Let's see... Uh-huh, this is clear. But here something's illegible. Hmm. In short, it says here that the drug is experimental, not enough tests have been conducted yet, so use at your own risk and only with written consent from the patient. Then there are some contraindications and possible side effects, I don't understand everything here... So, use with special caution during pregnancy, heh, that's definitely not about you...
Well? I don't really complain about my health in general, so you can skip that. The main thing for me is not to overdose, and that there's an effect.

Aha, here. Method of application. One vial once a day for ten days, necessarily on an empty stomach. Under doctor's supervision. It also says here that if by the fifth day of intake the patient starts experiencing symptoms like dizziness, severe shortness of breath, drowsiness, something else here... can't understand. Basically, you need to immediately stop taking it and follow the recommendations from some "manufacturer's brochure"... Something like that. Where's the brochure?
Doesn't seem like there was anything else. Alright, it's clear overall. It all sounds not very encouraging, but I think it's worth the risk. Thanks, science! I owe you one, see you.
Hi, Kruglov! I'm here with the instructions. Need a translation.
Huh? Instructions? Translation? Oh, I remember. Well, give it here, I'll take a look.
Here you go.
Change the music! It's gotten old.
Fork over a couple hundred, then I'll change it.
Take it... one hundred, two hundred.
Not giving you any. You'd charge for entry next, businessman, damn you...
What did you think... Nothing comes free...\nWhat do you want to listen to?
Put on some retro...
I'd like to hear something nostalgic...
Got any rock and roll?
Something more modern...
I respect retro too...
Alright, you'll get your nostalgia...
In Greece, they have everything...
Alright, I'll put it on now...
Actually, let this one stay...
Hello, what are we guarding?
And who might you be? Don't think we've met before.
They call me Marked One.

I'm Garik. I keep order in this dive. And I protect the peace of serious people, so that all sorts of drunks don't distract them from work. There, in the back room, an armor repairman works, they call him Lanky. And another one... Docent. He handles the technical stuff.
Can I go see them?
I won't let you through just like that.
I get that. How much?

My brother and I are going on a deep raid for artifacts soon. Tired of looking at these mugs already. We're gathering equipment, supplies, medicine.\nBasically, you give me antirad, maybe a medkit... military or scientific, and you can walk around freely.\nDeal?
Look, your respected people will be out of work with such a fee... for access to their bodies.
Don't worry about them. They have plenty to do.
When I have spare medicine, I'll drop by.
I need to see the repairman.
Remember the fee? Hand over the medicine.
I have antirad, I don't use them anyway, prefer vodka.
I have a medkit, military one.
Will you take a scientific medkit?
I'll drop by next time.
Picking up armor from repair? Lanky told me... go ahead.
So it's ready... Thanks.
Lanky didn't say anything. So hand over the medicine.
You've gotten tough, Marked One... Orders are to let you through.
Really? Well, I'm off then.
Go ahead!
Hic... ah, what a load of crap. Drunk again. They're gonna kick me out of Duty, you understand, if I screw up this assignment too. And I'm not in any state right now to... you know.
I understand, happens.
What can you understand... Let's have a little one... To our acquaintance!
I've got a special bottle, let's have just a bit.
I don't drink... almost. Only on holidays. So basically - no.
My kind of man! You, uh, come by... We'll talk about life.
No respect? Well, fine. Otherwise we'd, uh... talk about life.
You again? What did you want? The dear one's all gone... boring.
I'm in a bind myself.
So maybe a little one? Today's Tinsmith Day, I think...
That's a reason! What's your name again? Forgot, sorry...
They call me Marked One. Let's drink.
Oof... Name's Brome. There's such an element, chemical... exists.
Nice to meet you. Did you want to tell me something or what?
I did... Need to, uh... gather my thoughts.
Ah! Hey there, bro. Oh, life... Listen, you, uh, at least have a drink with me...
Ah... you... well, what's up?
Hic ...helped, yeah. Well, let's drink to Duty, I guess? Aaand... Oh!
Oh! What are you snooping around for? Who are you?
Marked One. Don't recognize me?

There's lots of you marked ones. Can't remember everyone. Name's Brome. There's such an element, chemical. Otherwise jokers keep bringing up army jelly...\nAlright, don't you see - I'm on duty, garrison patrol type thing. They could throw me in the brig.\nSo if you don't have business, march over to the bar, knock back a shot of tea for me...
You again? Just can't leave a man alone... We'll talk in the bar.
Well, as you say.
Ah, it's you. Hey there, buddy. Things didn't work out somehow...
What didn't work out?
Well... I left Duty. Got tired of it! This isn't right for them, that's not proper. They made it into barracks. But I have a soul. It demands. And they...
I see. And what now? What are your plans?
We'll see... There's a couple of people I can do business with. And without any drills and marching in formation. We'll see...
Hello from old boots. How are you? Everything alright? Well, good...
So what did you want? Or did you forget already?
Yeah, I have... A sec... ret! You smell?
I smell... You stink. Did you wash this year?

Uh... what? You listen to me! I'm telling you straight! And... what did I want? Ah!\nOne du... de owes me money. A pile. My legs... something's wrong with them. And my eye hurts. Well... You understand? Well?
No. What do you want?

Well you, uh, tell him, like, Brome, his buddy... I'm, like, dying, like. Just don't say where... Like, let him pay back what he owes. Understand? Grab him by the gills, shake him and... And then I'll tell you a great recipe... Cross my heart! Well...
We'll see. If I get the chance - I'll tell him.
Uh... what? You listen to me! I'm telling you straight! And... what did I want? Ah!\nYou want to know awe... awfu... damn it... Wait... A recipe, how to brew an arti - yeah! Want it?
Depends which one and for what...

Awesome! I'm telling you like my own! Seen "Tears..."? Yeah... And I can... Or rather knew. Well... Anyway. There's this recipe. And I'll tell you. You just bring me some vodka, eh? Well, about ten bottles... Eh? I want to go on a raid, and there might be radiation, or maybe some other nasty stuff. Gonna treat the guys. So what? Deal?
Alright. When I have vodka, I'll drop by.

Uh... what? You listen to me! I'm telling you straight! And... what did I want? Ah!\nYou see how it is... Yeah. Can't do it. Yeah. Without this poison! How many times I told myself - that's it! Not another drop, and again. Wasted. Help me, friend! I'll describe such a sweet deal to you - dear mama!
Didn't understand anything. What do you want from me?

Well, there's this doctor, they call him Boryan, lives in the Swamps. Real soulful guy. He knows a lot. Maybe he'll tell me how to deal with the green serpent. He brews all sorts of herbs there. I'd look for him myself, but I can't, my legs won't work and I'm all twitchy without a warm-up, and if I do warm up - that's it, I'm done. I can't go out into the Zone alone, and nobody will take me as a partner. And I understand myself - what kind of partner am I, I'll only get others killed... So what? If you see the doctor - will you ask him for me? And I'll give you a very useful recipe - how to brew a "Steel Kolobok", I know, they told me...
I'll try to find you a magic potion.
What do you want? Why are you drilling me with your eyes? Like what you see? You better go, or I'll take sin on my soul - punch you right between...
Cool down, sicko. Like I need you... I'm from Brome, know that Duty guy?

Well... Used to run with him, until he completely drank himself silly. He's got a good nose for dangerous spots. That's probably why he's still alive. One thing ruins him - can't resist the white stuff. Either removing radiation, or pouring protection from controllers... Well, God be his judge. Why are you suddenly asking about Brome?
He's, how to put it... Basically, he says you owe him money. Asked me to shake you down for the debt. Though he was drunk, Brome was, so there's no trust in his words, honestly.

I... what? I owe him?! Completely drank his brains away, fucking drunk! He owes me, not the other way around! In the last raid we lost all the loot because of him. Not that it was rich, but still - a capsule. He, this alconaut, dropped the backpack with the container when we had to fight off pseudodogs. We ran circles like "Papa Carlos"... You probably know yourself how it is with those dogs. Well, and then we couldn't find where Brome dropped the backpack. We searched and searched, all for nothing.
Where exactly? Maybe I could search too? I'll give you half of what I get for the capsule honestly, if I find it, of course...

I don't need anything. You, if luck smiles on you, better help that thirsty-suffering one. It happened in the Gut, near the district committee estate. Bad place - pseudodogs, hungry ones, tons of tushkanos. Look around there somewhere.
I hang around those parts often, I'll look when I get the chance. See you.
Where is it? Do you even remember what we agreed on?
Of course... I remember... but, vaguely.

I talked to your debtor. He says - it's still a big question who owes what to whom. He told me how you two were messing around in the Gut, fighting off pseudodogs, and how you lost the backpack with the container that had the found capsule in it. But he turned out to be a good guy, no complaints about you. And I, by the way, found that backpack with the container.
True buddy, yeah... so he's not mad? And that you found our loot - well you're... great, respect and all that! Listen, maybe you could pour a couple drops?

You'll manage without. You, if I remember, promised something for the return of your hard-earned money. Even though everything turned out differently in the end, but... Here's the capsule and container from the backpack. Tell me about your recipe.

Keep the container, I'll give the capsule to Barkeep right away anyway - let him open it. And the recipe is very useful and necessary, no kidding. Write this down, how to brew the modificate "Grandma's Beads". I know, they told me...
Got it written down. Now we're even. You should quit drinking so much, Brome. See you.
I brought you vodka. Ten bottles, all fair and square.

Well... You! Savior! Holy man! I, uh... I don't remember the recipe itself, I had it written down. And I hid the note in a stash. Well... The paper was in a bag, with it, the dear one. So we drank it, and the bag stayed there. I just don't remember exactly where. Either at the Village, when we were waiting in ambush. Or in the Gut, when... Well, I've been there.
Just my luck, got involved with a drunk... Take the vodka, have a swig, maybe you'll remember where specifically?

Don't get all worked up, benefactor, well, forgot a little - happens...
At the forgotten Village - I remember, we drank in the little shop, there's one there, it stinks from the swamp nearby - terrible!
Well, and if in the Gut, there's an old bus there, by the little bridge over the marsh. Well, under the bus, iron box, maybe I shoved it there...
Believe me, I'm not lying...
Well, we'll see. If I don't find it... I'll be back.
Still suffering, sick one, or feeling better already?
What better, everything's disgusting, even bad thoughts creep into my head - why do I live, what for.

You've really gone soft... I was at Boryan's, he gave you various herbs, how to take them - it's written there, so get treated. He said in about ten days it should let up, and if not, then you'll find him yourself, he's in the Swamps, lives at the northern farmstead. Here's your medicine. Haven't forgotten about the recipe?
You, Marked One, are a real man. Let's drink to this... Oh, what am I... Recipe?! Ah... yes... about "Steel Kolobok", write it down, since I promised.
You should at least wash yourself. See you.
You need to drink less. It'll clear up.
Maybe you're right, but the question is... debatable. You're without memory, and nothing, alive and kicking.
That's true...
Found it, here's your gun.

What? You found the gun? Wow! Brother, little brother, dear brother... I just have no words. Thank you. THANK YOU, damn it! Oh, you helped, you really helped!!! Sorry, I'm completely out of money, spent it all... But I have this one recipe, cherished! Never told anyone, but you... Haven't heard how to get "Electra's Tears"? Huh? Aha! Let me upload the info to your PDA, hope it'll be useful. And I won't forget, damn me, how you helped me. Hope I can help you the same way you helped me, with time. Thanks.\nAh! I also promised to tell you about the stash... A stalker said he hid loot in the Gut, there's tons of monsters there - few dare to go... There's a small bridge there, under it, in a little tunnel, he kept his loot for a rainy day. You'll see. Believe...

What? You found the gun? Wow! Brother, little brother, dear brother... I just have no words. Thank you. THANK YOU, damn it! Oh, you helped, you really helped!!! Sorry, I'm completely out of money, spent it all... But I have this one recipe, cherished! Never told anyone, but you... "Steel Kolobok"! I know how to get it... Let me upload the info to your PDA, hope it'll be useful. And I won't forget, damn me, how you helped me. Hope I can help you the same way you helped me, with time. Thanks.\nAh! I also promised to tell you about the stash... Some guy told me, about this very matter, that he hid loot in the Swamps, there's tons of monsters there - few dare to go... Said that at the motor depot by the wall, behind the trash container he tucked away a box. I haven't been there myself, but...

What? You found the gun? Wow! Brother, little brother, dear brother... I just have no words. Thank you. THANK YOU, damn it! Oh, you helped, you really helped!!! Sorry, I'm completely out of money, spent it all... But I have this one recipe, cherished! Never told anyone, but you... Heard of "Mama's Beads"? Well, I know how to turn that into "Grandma's Beads"! Aha! Let me upload the info to your PDA, hope it'll be useful. And I won't forget, damn me, how you helped me. Hope I can help you the same way you helped me, with time. Thanks.\nAh! I also promised to tell you about the stash... A friend of mine said he hid loot in the Red Forest, like there's tons of monsters there - few dare to go... I didn't ask for directions - didn't care, but he said there's an old mine there, with like a toilet in it... Somewhere there. I don't know whether to believe it or not, but to you - everything straight up...
What's in it for me?
I'll give you everything, buddy, just help me get the gun back, I'm asking you as a human being. There's no life for me without it.
More specifically? I understand you lost everything?

Maybe not everything! I know about one special place, a stalker shared it when he was dying. Get the gun - I'll tell you everything straight up! Believe me, bro... I'm not a bullshitter! Help me out, or this, fucking, well you know, Baldy doesn't want to see me anymore...
It's in your own interest.
No. I have more important things to do right now.
Your choice, but I hope you'll change your mind.
We'll see.

What are you looking at, brother... Think I'm drunk?
Well yes, I had a drink! I have the right! My soul is scratching like cats... Understand?
You don't understand anything...
I lost the family gun to that card sharp. Thought I'd win some arties for gear, but look how it turned out! And how it was going! Got "Moonlight", "Night Star"... And then... Damn!
Bro, maybe you could talk to that bloodsucker, eh? I need to get my gun back. It's a family heirloom, passed from father to son. And here you go - lost it. I'm practically attached to it, bonded, and now this mess.
Hi. Any news? Found it?
Thank you brother. I won't forget how you helped me.
Hi, bro. How's life? Everything alright? Well, mine's getting better too.
Left the bar? And what now?
Well... We'll see. I've got a good gun. Beasts are running around, some people pay good money for their guts. Life's possible!
Hello, friend Marked One. How are you? Good? Well, excellent.
Hello, stalker. Don't think we've met? I'm Tooth, and you?
Marked One. Having a drink? Or what?
Not quite. Haven't heard of me? I trade information in the Zone. Sell important intel, buy blueprints, documents and other useful information exclusives.
What brings you to me, stalker?
Ah, Marked One! Any news on our business in the Gut?
Hello, Marked One. Want to buy information? Or maybe sell?
Marked One? I heard you went off to Radar and disappeared for good. Didn't expect to see you again!
Yeah, you wish... And what are you doing here all of a sudden?

Most stalkers headed north, so I wanted to be closer to the epicenter of events too. And it's become unsafe in the Bar now. The Duty guys scattered, only a couple dozen people left from the whole faction.
I see. So you've moved here permanently?
For now, yes, we'll see later. So if you have any business in my line of work, now you know where to find me.
Hi, Marked One. What brings you to me this time?
I want to buy recipes from you.

Commendable desire, but not possible right now. I'm converting all my paper files to digital, and it's such a mess right now that even the devil would break his leg. And I don't sell recipes to just anyone. I'll definitely ask for a small favor first. But like I said, all that later.

I don't sell them to just anyone anyway, but for you, Marked One, I'll make an exception in exchange for one favor. If we agree, you'll get access to my entire collection of first and second level artifact recipes. We'll discuss prices separately later.
Well, you tell me... Keeping up with progress, huh? Well, I'll come by another time.
And what kind of favor? I have a rough idea what you do besides your main "profession", so just in case I'll warn you in advance: I don't do wet work.

I've heard about your principles, but I need something of a completely different nature.\nIn a few days, a very important cargo will arrive in the Zone for... respected people. I need to carefully transport it through Duty territory. As you understand, I have some greased palms in that structure, but the situation is such that for a number of reasons I wouldn't want to use regular channels. So I'm looking for a new intermediary, exclusively for a one-time delivery. Good pay, confidentiality and all that.
And what? Want me to go sign up with Duty real quick or something?

Don't talk nonsense. I want you to establish contact with a potential intermediary, I have one guy in mind. And convince him to work for me. Anticipating the question of why I can't do this myself - I need complete anonymity. So that if something happens, I can't be tied to this... operation.
I don't get something. You want to pass messages through me, like through a courier?

No, of course not. That would only attract unnecessary attention. Your job is to establish contact and get agreement for a one-time... side job, let's call it that. And from him I'll need a PDA connection code, so I can send him messages from an untraceable handheld.
Now I understand. Alright. Let's say I agree to talk to this Duty member. And who is this lucky guy?
Tooth, since you haven't named any names, I suggest we stop and forget about this conversation. I don't want to get involved in some shady spy games.
Wait! So you know him?
As you wish. That means you're out of luck with the recipes.
Know who?!
Lucky, who else. That's his nickname.
Oh... I just expressed myself that way. But actually yes, I know him. What a coincidence!
Oh... I just expressed myself that way. No, I don't know him.

Even better! Then get to work. How best to approach this character - decide for yourself, but I advise not to go straight at him. Chat first, find common topics, buy him drinks. Play it by ear, in short. There's time, but don't drag it out too much.

Then remember this. He usually stands guard in the hangar, the one closest to the southern checkpoint. Often hangs out here in the mornings with his colleagues. How you'll act - decide for yourself, but I advise not to go straight at him. Chat first, find common topics, buy him drinks. Play it by ear, in short. There's time, but don't drag it out too much.
I got it all. See you, conspirator.
Tooth, everything's cool. I made a deal with Luck...
Keep it down! Why are you yelling across the whole bar? Well, what's up?

Like I said, everything's good. He agrees. Can't stand his leadership, so he's ready to commit a medium-severity job violation without any qualms. For good compensation, of course. Here's his PDA connection code, copy it down.
So I wasn't wrong, calculated this rogue correctly. Well done, Marked One, excellent work. Here's a small bonus from me.
Thanks, of course, but what about the recipes?

Everything as agreed. Any first or second level artifact recipe from my collection. I accept two artifacts of second and third level respectively as payment. In excellent condition, mandatory. That's it, no haggling.
How much? Two second level artifacts for a first level recipe, and for a second level recipe - two third level? Are you completely f... out of your mind?!
Some offered more, but I'm not ready to do business with everyone, as I said. However, I'm not forcing you. Don't want it - don't buy it.
Tooth's Troubles

Haven't seen that Duty guy, Lucky, in a while. Remember him? He used to stand guard in the hangar every day, I constantly saw him there, and now he's disappeared, like he never existed. And he stopped appearing in the Bar. Any idea where he went?
I have no idea who you're talking about, Marked One.
But how? You yourself...

I'll repeat once more: I don't know any Lucky. And tell Voronin to stop sending his snoops to me. I'm not involved in the disappearance of his subordinates. That's it, move along. A client should be coming to see me now.
What? What's Voronin got to do with this? Nobody sent me, but judging by how you flipped out, maybe I should address my question to the general?
Wait... So you're definitely not from him? Some guy came here, also asking questions. But I figured him out quickly. Duty investigators are worthless.
I just wanted to ask, no hidden agenda. So something did happen to Lucky... something bad? And they're pressuring you because of it?

This all looks like a setup. Someone's started a game against me. And if it wasn't you who blabbed to the wrong people about our "negotiations" with the missing guy, then it seems I have a serious opponent working against me.
Like I'd blab about such a... delicate matter, yeah right. Maybe Voronin himself sniffed something out? Or suspects you. His man disappeared after all, so he's worried.

You know yourself how everything was arranged. He couldn't have sniffed anything out. Someone leaked our little secret to him. Or at least hinted about involvement. The general even bothered to assign a spy to me. Hangs around here all day, pretending to be drunk...

Listen, Tooth, aren't you being paranoid? This is the Bar, every second person here is a drunk. Maybe it's just a coincidence? Duty's looking for their guy, so they're questioning everyone who might know something.

I'm telling you: there's some bullshit buried here, I can feel it. You know, if our schemes come to light and Duty leadership finds out everything, you'll get caught in the crossfire too. So I suggest you play Pinkerton for a bit. Try to find out what really happened to this Lucky. Ideally - find him... or his remains. Then we'll think about how to make sure it doesn't all come back to us.\nAnd to motivate you even more, if this ends successfully, I promise to share any third level artifact recipe I know and provide access to buying recipes in this category in the future. What do you say to that offer?
When will I learn to stop getting involved in shady business?! Nothing but trouble afterwards... Alright, I'll try to find something out. Any ideas where I should start?

I'll say your imagination's running wild. And even if it's all true, since you organized this scheme, now get yourself out of it. I'm just a side player in this business - I only talked to the missing guy on your behalf and that's it. I'll manage to clear myself somehow.

Talk to the local drunks and regulars here. Surely someone saw or heard something. They're unlikely to open up to Duty bloodhounds. It's different with a fellow stalker.\nThat's it, now go. We've probably already attracted too much attention. Good luck!
Predictable. You figured out they can't really pin anything on you. Fine, forget you, I'll manage myself.

Tooth believes someone wants to frame him before Duty leadership, pinning the blame for the disappearance of a faction fighter nicknamed Lucky on him. If I manage to clarify the fate of the missing man or find him, I can choose any third level artifact recipe as a reward, and also get the opportunity to buy recipes in this category from Tooth.
How are you doing here? Still shaking that Duty will grab you by the gills? You can relax.
Did you learn something specific or just dropped by to crack jokes?

Can't get more specific than this. I found Lucky. Or rather, his body. He died nearby, in the backyard of this territory, behind Sultan's "office". Found several witnesses, thanks to whom I managed to reconstruct his movements on the day of disappearance. As for the cause of death, you could say it was an accident - torn apart by pseudodogs that somehow got into the backyard. There are, of course, some gaps in this whole story, but for some reason I think Duty won't dig any deeper.

So everything worked out in the best possible way for us. I mean, the guy died, sorry for him and all that, but... And there are witnesses too, which is also good. Now I can talk directly with Voronin to finally settle our misunderstanding. Whoever arranged this provocation against me, they miscalculated.
You're at it again? Stubbornly refusing to admit that nobody was trying to screw you over, and everything that happened is just an unfortunate coincidence. Ah, why am I even bothering!

Just so you know, Marked One, in my business you always need to look around and assume the worst. There are plenty of people wandering the Zone who dream of not just screwing me over in small ways, but putting a bullet in my head in the most literal sense. So I'm always on guard.\nBe that as it may, you helped me avoid major trouble. I keep my promise: now you can buy third level artifact recipes from me. The first one's free. Come by.
I will, don't doubt it.
Can you tell me, a Duty guy used to come here often, a certain Lucky, where can I find him?
How should I know? He hasn't shown up here for a week or so. Why do you need him, by the way?
Need him. Have business with him.

You're not the only one, apparently. People already came to me, also asking questions about this guy. But to me, he's just one of many visitors. I don't know anything about him or where to look for him. Go see Voronin or his deputies, he's their man after all.
Uh... yes, thanks for the advice.
Garik, I'm looking for someone. He's here constantly, name's Lucky.
Lucky... The Duty guy? Haven't seen him for quite a while. Probably went on a raid. Or he's drinking with his buddies in the barracks.
His own people are looking for him too, apparently. Don't remember when you last saw him?

Think it was last week... Or not?! Don't remember exactly. The local entertainment isn't too rich in events. Every day's the same. Here you can barely remember what happened yesterday, let alone a week ago. Unless they start a drunken brawl. Sorry, but I can't help you.
Seems you're not very observant for a guard. Alright, forget it.
Let me take a look at your recipe collection.
No problem. What level artifact recipes are you interested in?
First.
Second.
Third.
And what exactly do you want to learn to brew?
Sorry, I'm not ready to sell you recipes of this level yet. We'll discuss this later.
This category is closed to you. Can you guess why?
Jellyfish.
Wrenched.
Stone Blood.
Sparkler.
Droplets.
Slime.
Thorn.
Stone Flower.
Gravi.
Meat Chunk.
Flash.
Fireball.
Slug.
Crystal Thorn.
Night Star.
Goldfish.
Soul.
Moonlight.
Crystal.
Mica.
Urchin.
Here's everything I can offer for this artifact:
Since there's nothing else, I'll take this recipe.
Nah, this isn't what I need. Let's look at something else.
That'll be two fresh second-level artifacts. Got them?
Highway robbery, but what can I do... Take them.
Sweet! Uploading the recipe to your PDA...
I'll take the first one.
The second one works for me.
This will cost you two pristine third-level artifacts. Just reminding you.
Two third-level artifacts and two second-level ones in excellent condition for this recipe. Can you manage?
I owe you one. You'll get this recipe for free. Sure about your choice?
I probably can't afford that price right now. Another time.
I just remembered something important, let's get back to this conversation later.
Yes, I'm sure.
Tooth, I urgently, desperately need to know how to obtain a rare artifact - it's called "Snow".

Rare? Rarest of the rare! I don't recall hearing about anyone finding it in the Zone. As far as I know, you can only synthesize it by transforming another artifact. Lucky for you, I know how it's done. The price - a modificate. For old friendship's sake, I'll even accept one that's not fresh. I'm not bargaining. Won't budge a millimeter.
I was internally prepared for something like this. Ah well, you only live once! No point being stingy with... every modificate.
Oh, f... That's steep even for you. I'm not ready for such expenses right now.
I'm somewhat surprised your inner tightwad approved such expenses. As for the recipe, I recently managed to copy one curious piece of paper. Here it is in electronic form, you can take a look...
Yeah, wait, let me download it. You know, I think if I come to you next time asking for a "Jellyfish" recipe, you'll demand I bring you the Monolith...
Leave me alone, man...
As you wish.
You too, huh? *hic!*
Me too what? Are you alright?
Get lost... Or no, wait. Let's have a drink. My treat.
Then pour it.
I think you've had enough.
Well, cheers! Don't mind that I'm drunk... My soul's on fire. I've seen things nobody here has ever witnessed...
What have you seen? Wave your hands less - you spilled more than you drank.

Wait... hold on, I'll pour more, stories don't go down dry.\nSo there... Me and a friend were at Yantar once, on that territory... you've probably heard... factory or plant, hell knows what it used to be. We went in, everything seemed quiet. Started pushing deeper, then it started. Zombies crawled out of every crack like cockroaches. There were dozens of them. What am I saying, dozens - hundreds! I'm not lying, cross my heart. We barely managed to run into some hangar, otherwise they would've surrounded us in a moment.
Wait, I don't get it. How did you not notice and hear a whole horde of zombies around? They walk back and forth, mumble all sorts of nonsense, rattle their gear...

Listen, smartass... Don't interrupt me!\nSo, where was I? Ah, yes! Hundreds of zombies rushing at us. We keep them from the entrance, shooting, shooting, and they keep coming and coming. Tough bastards. They fall, get up, fall again... Our rifles were already red-hot, ammo running low, and the crowd has no end. I yell to Seryoga: take down the front rows, throw a grenade and try to jump through the window before they block us completely.

By the way, I want to clarify something. When did this happen? Because until recently, there was some kind of radiation hitting your brain at Yantar, right around the factory complex. Couldn't last long there, even with good protection.
Stop fucking interrupting! You don't believe me either? You think I'm standing here lying? And you see this gray hair?!
Alright, alright. I'm quiet, continue.

Made me lose my train of thought... Ah, right!\nWe emptied the rest of our mags, threw grenades and rushed to the window. And what do you think? Right under the window, on that side, an "Electra" had formed, no way to get out. Even though just a minute ago, when I looked around, it wasn't there. Well, that's it, I think - we're done! Then Seryoga says: let's run through the "Electra", it turns off sometimes. How, I say, does it turn off? And he says: I noticed it seems to fade periodically, just for a couple seconds, but we can make it...
Uhh... Sorry to interrupt, but I have a question. How did your friend manage to catch the pattern of the "Electra's" behavior if all you were doing was running and shooting?

How? I don't know. He was observant. Probably noticed while reloading. Why are you nitpicking every little thing?
Anyway... We waited a few seconds. Seryoga gives me the signal - go! I bolted and made it through. I hear the "Electra" discharge behind me, missing. I yelled to my buddy that I'm okay, that it's his turn now. No response. I yell louder, and again. No answer. Just some vague commotion and one voice monotonously repeating: kiiill! I crawled as close to the window as I could and saw something... This picture now haunts me every night in my dreams. No, I can't...
Basically, I ran out of there, not caring where. By some intuition managed to find the way back. Came to near the scientists' bunker. They ask me, where did such a gray-haired guy come from? I first downed half a bottle in one gulp to stop shaking, then told everything as it was.
Finished the story and say: give me backup, maybe Seryoga is still alive or managed to hide. And they tell me: too late to send backup - there's radiation there now. What fucking radiation? There wasn't any. Turns out, we accidentally slipped through during a low radiation intensity interval. Happens rarely, one nerd tells me, you were lucky. That's when I completely broke down and sat where I stood. When I imagined that five more minutes and I would've become just like those...
I don't even know what to say. Strange story. You're lucky to be alive after such a mess.

What kind of Lucky am I?! There was this guy serving in Duty, they actually called him Lucky. And you know why? He was doing a territory patrol once and managed to find a very rare artifact right on the road. Something from those... "ruby" ones, I think.

Oh, speaking of this Lucky! Here's the thing... I'm looking for him. He... owes me money. And he's in no hurry to pay back, judging by the fact that I can't catch him here. And nobody's seen him on patrol for a while apparently. You hang out at the Bar constantly, probably know many locals. Don't happen to know where my debtor might be hanging around?

How would I know? Saw him here last time a week ago, I think... Or was it the week before? Anyway, he was drinking one evening at that table over there, the next one, alone. Then some guy approached him. They quickly downed a shot each and left together. Lucky hasn't shown up here since.
So, what kind of guy came to him? Do you know him?

I figure Lucky owes you quite a bit of money. Otherwise why are you suddenly so worked up? Here's the deal: you get me some ammo, and I'll tell you everything about that guy. I'm tired of treating myself with vodka all day long, want to go on a raid. But I'm empty after that story, and drank away my whole stash. So, here's what I need: ammo for the Groza, armor-piercing, with "AP" index, about 300 rounds, at least ten VOGs, and... let's say five scientific medkits. Should be enough for starters.
Holy shit, that's quite a request... I'll think about it.
Hey there, pal. Got the gear for me or not? Getting restless sitting here...
I brought everything you asked for. Tell me about the guy Lucky left with, and you'll get your ammo.
I'm not your "order desk", don't rush me. I'll bring it when I can. If I can.

Well, there's not much to tell really. It was that weapon technician, name's Yurka. But everyone here calls him Lisaped. I remember they were arguing about something animatedly when they left. Seemed to me they couldn't agree on a price. But who was buying what - I have no idea.
That doesn't give me much, but at least it's some kind of lead. Take your stuff.
Great! I'll finish this bottle and hit the sack, get some sleep. And tomorrow first thing in the morning - off on a raid.
What brings you this time? I'm not pouring for free anymore, don't even hope.
Wasn't planning on it.

Looks like I found the first real witness - stalker Bagram. Need to help him prepare for his upcoming raid. If he gets 300 armor-piercing 9x39mm rounds, 10 VOGs and 5 scientific medkits, he'll be ready to tell who Lucky left the Bar with on the day he was last seen.
Yurko, tell me something: do you know a Duty member nicknamed Lucky?
What's your interest?
Well, it's... I'm looking for him, he owes me money. I was told you were seen with him at the Bar not long ago, and after that he stopped showing up there.
So he owes you too, then? What a bastard! I knew I shouldn't have gotten involved with him. He seemed shady to me right away...
What, did he screw you over? Want to tell me about it? Maybe together we can figure out how to squeeze what's owed from him. If only we could find him.

Well... to be honest, he doesn't owe me that much. Lucky contracted to supply me with weapon repair kits at a "tasty" price. I don't know where he was planning to get them from, maybe from his own people. We agreed on a trial batch - 10 pieces. I gave him a deposit, we agreed on a meeting, and then he just didn't show up. And that's it, not a word since then. Only one acquaintance mentioned he saw some guy near that place from a distance, shortly before the appointed time. That's the story... And I already managed to hint to my old supplier that I wouldn't be buying from him anymore. Now he'll probably jack up the price one and a half times compared to before...
Yeah, tough luck. Where were you supposed to meet? And who's this acquaintance?

Think you can pick up the trail? Listen, Marked One, this whole story is really stressing me out, you understand. A stern Duty sergeant already came to me, also making inquiries. I carefully changed the subject, but I don't want to quarrel with them. I operate on their territory after all. So I could point you to the place, but only if you promise not to share this information with anyone. That's one. And two - as confirmation of this promise and as a sign of gratitude for my trust in you, I'd ask you to get what the no-show Lucky promised me.
Uhh... what? Oh, I get it! You want me to sort of buy out his debt? Well, so be it. I'll bring you ten weapon repair kits as soon as possible. And uh... you should speak more plainly.

Talked to the second witness - Yurka Lisaped. Got the impression he knows more than he's saying, but he's willing to share information if I agree to buy out Lucky's debt to him - 10 weapon repair kits.
How's business? No downtime? I'm bringing you those repair kits.
You're right on time, Marked One. My supplies are almost exhausted, and I still can't agree on an acceptable price with my old supplier.
A stitch in time saves nine, as they say. Take them. Now tell me: where was the meeting with Lucky scheduled and who saw him?

Correction: I didn't say my acquaintance saw Lucky specifically. First, it was dark, second, it was drizzling, third, that guy was standing quite far away with his back turned. All he could make out was that he was wearing a Duty suit. Considering the meeting place was scheduled at the gates, a bit away from Duty's northern checkpoint, it could've been one of the guards who stepped away to relieve himself. As for the acquaintance, it's Sultan. You know him? He also works with weapons, trades rare guns. We sometimes cross paths to chat about common topics.
So I'll have to pay Sultan a visit. I'm sure that character won't even answer "what time is it" for free. Oh, these searches are going to ruin me...
Got a question for you, somewhat unusual. Yurka Lisaped signaled that you might know something about a missing Duty member. His nickname's Lucky.
Yurets fed you some nonsense. Was he tipsy or what? I don't know any Lucky.
Alright, let's approach this differently. A week or maybe even two ago, late in the evening, you saw someone here at the gates, a person in a Duty suit. It was raining that day. Try to remember...
Well... Maybe I did see someone. What's it to you?
I'm looking for him. And Lisaped is looking too, by the way. He screwed us both over...
Screwed you over, you say? Well, well... There was someone at the gates, yes, but as you already know, I didn't get a good look at him. I have nothing more to add.
Wait... Didn't you see anyone else there that day? Or nearby? Or maybe you noticed something else, unusual, strange?

Hard to say... Not really. Although... When I was getting ready to bed down for the night, I heard through the rain noise, like someone was dragging something heavy past the garage. That characteristic sound. Looking out on the street, I didn't see anything. And in the morning there were no traces. Though, could've been my imagination. Especially since further into this yard, there's no way through anyway. There's a tricky anomaly there. Throws whoever gets caught in it back onto the road, over the fence. Unless, of course, you know one trick.
What trick?

If you hang a special artifact on your belt, the anomaly will let you through. I happen to have a spare one. I use it sometimes for my needs. I can let it go. Transfer 30 thousand to my PDA - and it's yours.
I hope you're not planning to slip me some fake crap? That's serious money, need to balance the books.

The improvised investigation led me to Sultan. For 30 thousand he agrees to sell an artifact that can help overcome teleport anomalies to get deep into the utility yard, where it might be possible to pick up the trail again.
I've thought about your offer regarding the "special" artifact. I agree.
I understood right away that you're serious about finding your... swindler. Waiting for the transfer.
Thirty thousand sent. Got it?
Yep, all good. Your artifact. Don't mind that it's heavily used. Should still last a long time for passing through the anomaly.
It better be.
Well, what do you want?
What's new?

They say bloodsuckers have bred so much in the Wild Territory - you can't get through. Everyone knows that when they drink blood, they become stronger and meaner. And just the other day a Duty squad vanished there, probably ran into those bloodsuckers. Now people avoid those parts like the plague...
I'll keep that in mind, thanks.
If only our protectors would conduct a major raid there already...
How are things?
Yes?
Got anything interesting to tell?

Know about the scientists' camp at Yantar? They were dropped there by helicopter, and they regularly deliver provisions by air too, so science has set up nicely there. You can talk to them, they eagerly buy artifacts, and might even throw you some work occasionally.
Thanks for the information.
You could've bought me a shot.
Ah... it's you.
You need me? Want something?
Just... to hear what people are talking about?

About different things. Yesterday there was a guy here, talking about some faction. Legends about them circulated all over the Zone at one time... People said both good and bad things about them, but few knew the truth. Seems they wanted to deal with the Zone, tried to get to the bottom of its origins. For that, almost all other factions hunted them, but nobody knew where their main base was. Anyway, at one point they found some very important information, and part of the faction rushed to the center of the Zone. Half fell on the approaches, but the rest managed to reach their goal. What happened to them after, nobody knows. They vanished, it seems. The remaining ones who didn't participate in that raid just scattered wherever. That's the story.
And what was that faction called?
Hell if I know. Something about the sky.
Oh! Hello again!
Got anything else interesting to tell?

Know about the radiation in the north? Nobody can break through the "Brain Scorcher". There were several witnesses here recently who saw some stalker at Radar cross the invisible boundary and suddenly fall, and after a few minutes he got up with difficulty and walked deeper toward the antennas without looking back...
That's some weird stuff.
Yeah... gives me the creeps.
I see you're frequenting the Bar...
Looking for someone to drink with?
No, I'm more interested in news...

Heard about the zombified? From time to time, stalkers who disappeared long ago come out to the camps. Terrible sight, I tell you. Once one of them dragged himself to a Duty outpost, a bunch of people gathered to gawk then. They even recognized him, he used to drink at the Bar often. But there... scary, red eyes, all covered in bruises, can't say anything, just moans and walks in circles. Duty took him in, but he died after a couple of days. Something happens to people in the Zone. But what?
I'd like to know
Sometimes it's better not to know about some things...
Hello, curious one!
What do you want?
What's the news?

Empty zombie husks wander around the dried lake at Yantar. If they see someone, they start shambling after them in a crowd. That's when you need to leg it, because even though they're dumb, there's a lot of them there...
Yeah, you need to be doubly careful in those places.
Yeah, or just don't go there at all.
Huh?
Well, hello, stalker.
Hello, what's the word?

They say that somewhere in the center of the Zone there's a "Klondike of artifacts"... and supposedly whoever manages to find it will become fabulously rich. But here's what I think: surely all these rumors are spread by traders. Makes sense - they think about their profit, because rare artifacts appear closer to the center anyway. So they're trying to encourage stalkers to quickly find a safe path north. Or that tale about the "Wish Granter"... supposedly there's something there, either alien or from some other dimension altogether... I even heard a legend about a stalker who allegedly reached it. It's all nonsense, of course.
Yeah, hard to believe in such things.
Yet there are fools who do...
Yes?
Hi.
What are people gossiping about?

Well, somehow the conversation turned to those psycho Monolith guys. They worship their Monolith, though they've never seen it and in general... nobody can know for sure if it exists. Someone was talking about a giant invisible crystal that fell from the sky. Or I also heard a version that the Monolith is an absolutely alien living organism from another dimension... Ha-ha. I think it's much simpler. Somewhere up north, one of the secret laboratories exploded. One guy even claimed he used to work there. They conducted some psychotron experiments... psychotropic... basically, they worked on some brain-breaking stuff. Probably after the explosion some equipment survived and continues to work, that's why everyone in that area goes nuts. Some start dreaming about Monoliths and such, while others just moo and drool... That's how it is.
Hmm, interesting theory.
You bet!
Looking for something?
What's up, guy, bored?
Not really... I'm planning to go north, looking for someone who could tell me what awaits me there.

North? Not far from here at all, on the road to the "Brain Scorcher", a faction calling itself "Freedom" has settled at an old military base. Shady bunch, if you ask me. Pure anarchy. What they live for, what they want - hard to understand, but they haven't been caught in mayhem either. They're sluggishly feuding with Duty. I can give you good advice - don't get involved with them, only complete nutcases join that faction.
Thanks for the advice.
"Thanks" doesn't gurgle. Just kidding, relax.
Got any proposals?
What do you want, stalker?
I'm planning to move north soon, can you tell me what I should be most wary of there?

Lots of things... Mercs, for example. Those jackals will agree to any atrocity as long as they get paid. They say somewhere in the Zone they have a fully equipped base, but nobody knows exactly where. One guy was saying they've settled in Limansk. Stalkers rarely go there, so maybe it's true.
Looks like I'll need to keep my ears open in this Limansk.
You should never relax in the Zone anyway.
We've met before, I think? What did you want?
Hi, stalker. Dropped by to rest and relax or looking for someone?
Hi, Marked One. What brings you here? Changed your mind about playing?
I know this "rest", nothing but vodka probably... So yeah, more like looking.
Well, don't say that, don't say that. There are options. And for serious conversations - you should go to Barkeep or approach that guy by the counter, they call him Tooth.
I see. And what "options"?
Let's get acquainted first, shall we. What should I call you, pal?
Marked One. And your name?

Look at the top of my head, heh... Baldy - that's what they call me here. And regarding rest... Maybe we'll throw some dice? I've accumulated some artifacts, and you can't get a good price for them here. How about this: I bet artifacts, and you bet money. Deal?
Barkeep told me that your command has some kind of assignment for me.

Yes, he informed us about you, but before we let you through, I must familiarize you with our rules. So listen, our rules are simple. First rule - shooting on our territory is forbidden. After two violations, our patrol opens fire on you. Even if you make a run for it, you won't appear on our territory again, the guards will take care of you. Behave calmly and you won't have problems.
Got it. Is that all?
Yes, that's enough. You may pass.
Stop! Entry to the bunker is only for faction members or with a special pass.
What are you standing around for? Come on, pass through.
Why don't you let outsiders in?
Where did you crawl out from, so naive? We're at war here, understand? With the Freedom bandits. Regular skirmishes with their fighters in the Wild Territory.
War with the Freedom faction? Why?
Because the Freedom bandits have no place in the Zone, they must be destroyed. If you're interested, ask Barkeep, he'll explain everything, I'm too busy for this.
Stop! Entry to the bunker is only for faction members or with a special pass. If you don't have one, then turn around, man.
What are you standing there for? Pass through quickly.
Good health to you, comrade general! I was told you're looking for a volunteer to perform some task at the Army Warehouses.

Marked One! You're exactly who I need... I want to ask you to do something for me personally, understand? Recently one person went to the Warehouses... from our people. So, you seem to be a smart and quick guy, as they've told me here. Need to quietly find out who he went to and most importantly - with what. You see, there's a situation: I have a suspicion that I want to clarify without attracting unnecessary attention. That's why I need a reliable person from outside, you get it?
Not really yet... What and from whom should I find out there? Ask every Tom, Dick and Harry?

No, no... You shouldn't flap your tongue too much. You need to carefully, as if casually, find out information about that courier. Find the Freedom base, you'll figure out on the spot how to behave to earn the aborigines' trust. Try to visit one Freedom drunkard - they call him Cook. By the way, they keep him there as a cook. Everyone drinks there, so take plenty of vodka with you. Now for the main thing: I'm interested in whether a little man with a special briefcase came to them. Well, like a case, white one...\nSo, are you in?
Alright, I generally agree, especially since it's on my way anyway. But what if I can't find out anything?
No, I'm not ready for such feats yet.

If it doesn't work out, it doesn't work out. But do try, because I can't give such a task to my own people yet. \nAnd one more thing. A certain Major Cherepanov with his guys disobeyed my order and went on an unauthorized raid on Freedom territory. If you meet his group at the Warehouses - don't provide them any assistance, and better yet - don't talk to them at all. That's all, go.
If it doesn't work out, it doesn't work out. But do try, because I can't give such a task to my own people yet.
Your choice. And this conversation never happened - don't think of blabbing to anyone.
General Voronin asked me to find out about the fate of a courier at the Army Warehouses. He advised to approach Cook and take plenty of vodka with me
I saw your message on the network, about looking for a quick stalker... here I am. Still relevant?

Quick indeed. You were the first to respond. Anyway, listen. Just recently there was a commotion in the Dark Valley involving the military... by the way, do you happen to know what happened there? No? Alright, not important. According to operational information, the local thugs had a split and part of the psychos left the gang of the well-known authority, Borov. As it turned out, they didn't leave empty-handed, but took the "accounting" and other important papers of their former patron.
You're not that quick, there were faster guys. That's it, train's gone.
So what? Let them tear each other apart, simple stalkers will at least breathe freely while they're settling scores among themselves.
Oh, I see...

That's all true, of course, but we also have our own interest in those stolen papers. I would send fighters for them, but a military operation has been declared in that area and we were... strongly asked to stay away from the Dark Valley for now. On the other hand, for you, a loner, it won't be difficult to sneak past army patrols, if there are any still there. With the criminals, as I know, you've already built bridges of friendship. And even if you've quarreled, you're an experienced guy, you won't get lost. In short, you've probably already guessed what I want from you, right?
General, don't count on my insight - say it straight.

I... umm... we, that is Duty, need to get these documents at all costs. When the military raid began, there was commotion, some bandits tried to flee. Of course, they took the papers with them, but the thug who had them caught a bullet and dropped the briefcase. According to my informant, this happened somewhere in the building of an old, abandoned factory with a boiler room. Approximately on the second floor. The factory itself is right near the bridge over the swampy stream, if you don't know. That's where the "splitters" were quartered.\nThat's the briefing. Will you try to find this case for m... for us? Just watch out, surely other quick stalkers will show up soon and I'll give them the same task. I don't advise delaying if you don't want to be outrun. Don't worry about the reward, Duty values those who help it.
Interesting story. Alright, I'll try.
No, I'm not ready for a race against time right now...
As you wish, we'll offer it to another, more needy stalker...
I visited the Dark Valley. Is this the briefcase you wanted to get so badly?

It is, exactly it! Thank you so much! Mmm... How to thank such a distinguished person? I think the best reward is recognition of your merits by all of us! Just kidding, relax. Here, take some ammo, I think it won't be superfluous...
It won't be... yeah.

A rookie? Don't think I've seen you before. Though by your appearance you should be an experienced stalker... Where did you get worked over like that? Alright, I understand - sticking my nose where it doesn't belong. Here on business? Or just looking around?
I'm not really a rookie. Just don't remember what and how. So you don't know me? Haven't heard about Strelok? By the way, I'm Marked One.

Marked One. Good, then we're acquainted. My name is Voronin. I command the most cohesive and disciplined faction in this anomaly. "Duty" - that's what unites us, what gives us strength in our constant struggle against the hostile manifestations of the Zone.
Well, I've already heard about you. General, right?

Let's say - acting commander. And ranks are given based on deeds and skills. Within Duty there's a strict hierarchy, can't be any other way. That's why - yes, general. By the way, Duty always needs recruits, especially glad to have experienced stalkers...\nLook around here, talk to the fighters. If you decide to join - come see me.
I'm more used to being on my own.
Well, your choice. If you want to just help without joining the ranks, so to speak, then drop by. We sometimes cooperate with regular stalkers and no one has complained about the payment yet.
What brings you to me, brother?
Ah, it's you... Any news?
Hello, Marked One. What brings you here?
Well, what did you drag yourself here for?
Can I leave my loot with you for safekeeping now?
With me? Who fed you that nonsense?
The main Duty guy told me that you can store loot at the bar. And he doesn't take it anymore, says there's no people to guard it...
Well, at the bar, not with me. Like I'd have nothing better to do than store your stinking tails. Go see the nerds. Seems they agree to watch stuff for a short time.
Well, the bar - that's you. So I thought...
Think more often, maybe something smart will come up. Just kidding, don't grind your teeth. Ask Docent. You're always running some kind of business with him. He won't refuse.
Actually, that's true. I'll drop by his place.
Can you watch my loot?
Yeah, sure, fewer people now. Everyone rushed off for the long artifacts... It's gotten boring in this viper's nest. And there's almost no one to exchange a beautiful word with...
Well, well, here we go again. So, you'll watch it?
Aha! You just help out a bit. Well, you understand...
Yeah, where would we be without that... What kind of help?

Should be abundantly clear... You're not here for the first day, right? Artifacts, can't do without them. A simple artifact... Any one. A couple days of access. Watching - a week. After that - we'll see, you should understand...
I get it, I'm gone for a week - the loot floats away...
Want to leave some loot. What do I owe?
Please, good sir, grease the hinges of reliable storage with a good arty...
Not yet, you can store your treasures... Should I open it?
Open it, open it. And don't stare...
Alright. All-powerful sir, access to the body, ugh, to the safe, is open...
What's gotten into you people here... Here, take it, grease away...
Uhh... I changed my mind. I'll manage without it.

Hmm... Good day. What wind brings you here? Don't think I've seen you before. I'm Colonel Petrenko, General Voronin's deputy for logistics and some other delicate matters. And you, who are you? What's your name?
I'm Marked One. Trying to make my way north, looking for Strelok, Ghost, or those who might know about them.

I've heard about Strelok and Ghost. Though it's been a while. More than half a year ago, and in the Zone, if someone's unknown for more than a month, they're most likely dead.
So - Marked One. Well then.
I deal with free stalkers. Sometimes it's even useful - to entrust certain matters to those not directly connected with Duty.
So if you want to get something useful for your search, come see me.
I might just do that.
Hello, hello. How are you? Got strength? How's the search?
Greetings, Marked One! Will you help turn one little deal?
Ah, Marked One, is that you? What about our business, were you at Yantar?
Glad to see you, Marked One. Still looking for Strelok? Or what?
Ah, Marked One! Also have business with Sakharov or just dropped by the eggheads to restock supplies?
Hi! You here on business? I'm a bit busy here...
Uhh... Yeah, just helping science bit by bit. On mutually beneficial terms.
Good cause. Alright. Something important? I don't have time. And note: for all exchange and trade matters, find me at the Duty base.
What do you want? Make it quick, I'm on duty, as you can see.
Ah! It's you... Why are you still here and not rushing like everyone else for the "long" artifacts?
Profit doesn't interest me, I have my own path... What about you?

I talked it over with the guys and decided: someone has to protect this place! When these treasure hunters get their asses kicked and crawl back, then we'll see who's right. Our task is to protect the world from the Zone! Well, if not the world, then at least this piece of it...
What's happening anyway? Can't make heads or tails of it...

Haven't you heard? Everyone's gone crazy! Looks like the "Brain Scorcher" broke down, or maybe someone managed to find and pull the right switch! It's not working anymore, in short. So everyone without an inner core rushed there - to the center... To Pripyat, to the station itself. And I talked it over with the guys and decided: someone has to protect this place! When these treasure hunters get their asses kicked and crawl back, then we'll see who's right. Our task is to protect the world from the Zone! Well, if not the world, then at least this piece of it...
Oh, hi, old man! Glad the mutants haven't eaten you yet.
There was some kind of slaughter in front of the outpost, what happened?

Those are remains from the last "wave" of mutants that came before the emission. Three-four days of calm, then another wave. If it weren't for us, there'd be no Bar or Duty left, we're the last barrier against the crazed packs of mutants. Many of ours fell here.
I'd like to know something.
What exactly?
I'm here for the first time, can you tell me a bit about this place?

Before the accident in '86 this was an industrial zone. Now, as you can see, only ruins remain. On the territory there's the "100 Roentgen" bar, it's to the left from the entrance to the inner courtyard, further you'll find the descent to the basement. Stalkers from all over the Zone gather there, and the local trader moonlights as a bartender, maintains the premises, so to speak. If you want to trade, chat, or find work - head there. Also on the territory you'll find a couple of technicians for gear repairs and a couple of traders. You can get water and charge batteries. The Duty faction base is also located here, you've heard about us already, I bet? This whole area is under Duty's protection, so behave yourself and don't grab for your gun unnecessarily.
Thanks for the information.
Brome asks to find his shotgun "Benelli M4 Super 90 (M1014)", lost in the village at the Army Warehouses
Why so sad, stalker?

I lost a friend, you understand, a close friend, Sanya! Eh... Basically, we once decided to go on a trip with my buddies, Sanyok and Romka. We ran out of money, so we took a job from Barkeep to bring bloodsucker tentacles, the scientists needed them for something. We were heading to the village at the Army Warehouses, the abandoned one that stands west of the road, you've been there probably? I had a Benelli M4 Super 90 shotgun, Sanyok had an AK-74, and Romka always walks around with his personalized Abakan. We're standing on a hill, facing the village, backs to the road. It's radioactive there, by the way - real bad, so you shouldn't linger long. So we're standing, and there's such silence... oppressive... like someone's squeezing your ears. Darkness all around, night time, and there's more bloodsuckers at night, Barkeep told us that. The houses look so sinister, as if some horror is hiding in them. Not just a hostile creature, but as if the houses themselves and the ground are evil. We loaded our weapons, attached flashlights and moved forward single file. Quietly, so as not to reveal ourselves prematurely.
Well?

We're walking, and then Sashka manages to step on a bone! That crunch is still in my ears. As if it wasn't a rat's skull, but a sheep's leg breaking! We're standing like statues, imagine, Minin and Pozharsky with flashlights on their foreheads, and ballerina-Sashka in a swan pose. I wanted to both laugh and cry then. I see a bloodsucker's paw reaching for Sanyok, but no, my tongue is stuck, mind is empty, feels like a "Burner" went through my soul. Sanyok seemed to realize something and turned to look what's behind him, and the bloodsucker... the bloodsucker... black like that... disgusting, latched right onto his face, with its mouth! I puked canned food then. Good thing Romka's not such a sissy, immediately put a burst into that monster's head... We ran out of there - athletes would be jealous. I came to near the Bar, Romka was carrying me in his arms. I'll be grateful to him forever. But poor Sanyok! Come on, brother, pour, let's drink to him...
Well, cheers.
Eh... feels so nasty in my soul. Maybe one more?
Sure, why not.
And a third, for even count.
Put out your glass.

What I'm getting at... If you're at the warehouses, maybe check there, on the way to the village, maybe my Benelli is still lying somewhere? Or maybe I lost it on the way to the Bar. I wasn't myself, don't remember. I'll pay you honestly, I have a good artifact.
If I'm in those parts, I'll look when I have a chance.
So a bloodsucker can get me like your buddy? Nah.
Don't doubt it, the artifact is really good, you'll be satisfied.
Don't have any with me, next time.
I found your shotgun, Brome.
What? Ah, the Benelli! You're the man, Marked One!

I wouldn't celebrate too much if I were you. I don't know if you managed to mess it up to such a sorry state yourself or if it got damaged from falling, then lying who knows how long in the mud under rain and wind... Without a major overhaul I wouldn't risk walking around the Zone with such a weapon. Anyway, I did my part. Take the gun.
Yeah... and what am I supposed to do with this scrap metal now?! Alright, any way you slice it, a deal's a deal. Take the artifact, as promised.
I thought you'd balk... Nice to deal with decent people.
Hi, can we chat a bit?
Well... I'm not much of a storyteller, but what interests you?
Where does all the weapons in the Zone come from? Everyone here has two or three guns, not counting pistols and grenades. And you need ammo too, and all sorts of other crap.

Well, it's not for nothing that almost everyone here runs around with Kalashnikovs, there were weapons here even before the Zone appeared. And when the Zone appeared and everyone was kicked out, several abandoned weapons depots remained as a gift for the first stalkers. Well - that same weaponry is still enough. It doesn't go anywhere, heard of such a law of nature? Nothing disappears anywhere. Some stalker gets caught by an emission, another picks up his toys... Maybe brings them to me, sells them, and I'll give them to some rookie, repair if needed.
Yes, indeed, it's all simple.
That's the circulation of weapons in the Zone.
Well, let's say standard military weapons are clear, but you have plenty of other weapons. You can even buy an FN-2000? Where's that from?

Well... Sometimes stalkers bring them with themselves, before getting into the Zone and becoming stalkers. They also say a couple of foreign special forces visited us. The military carries some guns. And you can see yourself, there's much less of such weapons, and it's more expensive.
Everything's clear then. Still somehow doesn't add up, you have some completely new guns there.
A good trader always has his secrets, and connections with the outside world. In general, if necessary, you can get anything, for big money, naturally.
So I can come to you?
You don't have that kind of money. Sorry, I need to work, talked too much with you. Buying anything?
Sometimes I go crazy from this Zone. Have you noticed this in other stalkers?
It happens, of course, the Zone breaks stalkers, but such don't last long, they're done for in the Zone, so they're rarely seen here. Though there are exceptions.
I see, need to get a grip.
Well, you're not a pushover, if anything, treat yourself with vodka - and you're good.
What kind of exceptions?

There was a guy here once, one of the first stalkers. They called him Beldyuga. So, his roof was definitely blown, either the Zone tuned him up, or he came to the Zone like that already... He was lucky though, despite being a loner, who'd walk the Zone paired with a psycho... He was always alive and always with artifacts. Sometimes the Zone would rough him up good, a mangled arm there... But always alive, and wounds healed like on a pseudodog.
I see, and where is he now?

He died stupidly. He liked to make all sorts of modifications for weapons, but in his own way. Sometimes attached artifacts to the bolt on a Kalash, sometimes a bunch of pistols... Hell knows how that crap helped him. Of course, others couldn't understand such nonsense. They say he once managed to tie an RPG to a rifle with rope, well somewhere in the Zone a group of stalkers met him, made fun of him... He up and fired his "underbarrel" point-blank at their feet. Seems everyone died, though that's what they say... Maybe some beast just ate him.
I see...
How did you end up here yourself?
That's none of your business. Want to know anything else?
I have a package for you here.
What package? From whom?
Sidorovich sent a case from the military checkpoint, said you could decipher those papers inside.

Let's see, so... this is useless to us, this is outdated... so, there's information about a road... apparently, the military found out about a path that goes from the Dark Valley to the Foggy Thicket. Will they really risk trying to go through there? Just feel sorry for the boys, they'll lose soldiers for nothing! Experienced stalkers don't even risk going into the Foggy Thicket, and here! Though... they say Borov's people used that path. Well anyway, look - this is the path they found out about. Be careful there, just in case...
Alright, I'll keep that in mind.
I have a problem. Was told to come to you.
Why are you all black or something? Ah... So you caught it... Well alright, let's have a drink.
You mean the "Black Mark"? Is it that noticeable on me? Know anything about it?
You should pour for the conversation... My throat's gone dry.
No problem. Just let's not go overboard.
Nothing to pour. Maybe another time.

You're insulting me! I just need to wet my throat... Alright listen here.\nThis mark... It's alive. Like all living things, it needs to feed on something. And you know what it eats? The life force of its victim. It's like in vampire movies. Seen the one about Dracula? Only here instead of blood... Hey, are you listening or what? Drop some more!
Well, let me pour. Just don't pass out.
I get it with you. Anyway, I'm leaving.

How can you turn off the fire that burns inside?! So what was I? Ah, yes! About the mark.\nI'm telling you, it drinks your life force and gets poisoned by it, because it's not of this world. It's alien to our world and the "food" here doesn't suit it, but it doesn't know how to feed any other way. Like any parasite, being no smarter than my ex-mother-in-law, once it latches onto a victim, this creature can't let go anymore. I had a buddy, he endured for several days and the mark died on its own. The main thing is not to let it stop getting poisoned once it's latched onto you, otherwise it'll fully recover. Don't throw it on the ground, don't hide it in stashes, don't stuff it in a container, understand? Let it choke on your life. And another thing. Don't hang around places where there are lots of people. This infection senses there's an abundance of food around, even if such food is poison for it. Then the "Black Mark" sort of goes into hibernation, apparently to pretend to be something harmless to other potential victims. It continues to draw strength from the carrier, though less, but in this mode it can last much longer. That's how it is...
